name: Hard Art and Symbolism in India Quiz / Test | Art | 10 Questions

questions.text: What are the male and female names of the standing sculptures from the late Mauryan period?
questions.explanation:
Yakshi or Yaksha.

	The Yakshi and Yaksha represent female and male Earth spirits. These figures can be seen in the round.

questions.text: Vishnu is often seated on nagas. What are they?
questions.explanation:
serpents.

	The nagas were dangerous, destructive serpents and enemies of the eagle Garuda, who happened to be their cousin.

questions.text: Old Hindu places of worship have a distinctive chaitya. What is the chaitya?
questions.explanation:
Hall.

	Along each side of a chaitya are columns and at the end, a dome.

questions.text: The Buddha is often depicted in numerous birth stories or previous existences. What are these stories called?
questions.explanation:
jatakas.

	Jatakas are often depicted on stupas in relief form.

questions.text: What does the bodhi tree represent?
questions.explanation:
enlightenment.

	The Buddha was sitting under a bodhi tree when he received enlightenment.

great release.

	There are pathways in Asia that lead up mountains or hills, with various stupas along the way. Monks walk up and down the hill representing nirvana, or great release.

questions.text: What does a vacant umbrella over a vacant space mean?
The Buddha is sometimes seen turning a wheel. What does the wheel represent?
questions.explanation:
law.

	Again, this is often depicted on relief sculptures. These reliefs were used to teach people who were illiterate about the Buddhist faith, much as Early Christians used murals to teach those who could not read.

questions.text: One popular kind of sculptural depiction in India is of a woman who can by the mere touch of her foot cause a tree to bloom. By what name is she called?
questions.explanation:
shalabhanjika.

	With a voluptuous body, she was often depicted to represent growth or fertility.

questions.text: What does a dot between the eyebrows, called an urna, represent?
questions.explanation:
eye of spiritual wisdom.

	This dot is often shown on bodhisattvas and other holy figures.
